p: The results obtained revealed that A. monosperma and L. crithmoides possess a considerable amount of SMs as phenolics, flavonoids, tannins and alkaloids in extracts of their leaves and stems. Some studies reported that the rise of salinity results in an increase in the content of plant polyphenol as in the alkaloids content of Achillea fragrantissima and Solanum nigrum [ 42]. On the other hand, in response to drought, there is a rise in the level of plant secondary metabolites as in Catharanthus roseus, Hypericum brasiliense and Artemisia annua [ 42]. Moreover, a noticeable variation in the levels of volatile compounds was recorded in Thymus vulgaris under water-stress conditions [ 43].
